intro: Gossypium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate cotton or narrowleaf cotton, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 1 meter in height, with hairy stems and capsule fruits that contain fluffy seeds. Gossypium lanceolatum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
